page.title: 11BUILDINGS
page.content: The block cannot boast of architecture in the grand English tradition but it does have many examples of fine vernacular styles. There are still a few timber framed houses to be seen with exposed woodwork. Some buildings are made of sandstone. Houses constructed in the last 300 years or so up until the First World War were made of mellow brick laid upon a foundation of large blocks of old red sandstone. No thatched roofs were found in the area, tile is the predominant roofing material with slate being used on a few roofs.
